content: Finally, #14752 compiles ! Written by @Filippo A. E. Nuccio and I, it corrects the definition of the topology of valued rings which had forgotten to take into account the fact that in written sources, the valuation map is often assumed to be surjective, but this is only written in small print.
We still need to streamline some parts of it, and maybe make it easier to use, but it compiles!

What we do, given a valuation v, is to define v.rangeGroup₀, the smallest submonoid of the codomain of v which contains the image and is a GroupWithZero. It allows to define a restricted valuation v.rangeGroup₀_restrict in terms of which critical definitions are given.

Some theorems were mathematically wrong, such as docs#Valued.continuous_valuation, but we provide Valued.continuous_valuation_of_rangeGroup₀_eq_top which proves the same when Valued.v.rangeGroup₀ = ⊤.
We had to prove that assumption for LaurentSeries. Presumably, it will be useful for p-adic fields as well.

I only speak on my behalf here, but I think it would be useful that this PR (with appropriate modifications and suggestions, certainly some golfing) is merged rapidly, because all other works in progress on valued fields need to take into account the correction of this definition.

Antoine Chambert-Loir said:

Some theorems were mathematically wrong, such as docs#Valued.continuous_valuation, but we provide Valued.continuous_valuation_of_rangeGroup₀_eq_top which proves the same when Valued.v.rangeGroup₀ = ⊤.

This theorem has never been wrong. It is even formalized! I guess you mean that the analogue of this theorem for the other definition does not hold.
Don't you think there's more meaning in mathematics than in the mere alignment of symbols it makes use of?
